Welcome to the personal website of Brian M. Lin!

About Me

My name is Brian Lin and I’m a happy hardware developer. I’m studying Computer Science and Electrical and Computer Engineering at Duke University.

I love making things- music with friends, grumpy cat coasters, and sometimes even mistakes. I’m building a RoboSub as part of Duke Robotics and working on a study-buddy finder app with a group of friends.

Some other fun facts about me…

   I am a Mechanical Keyboard enthusiast.

   I am a host for TeaWithStrangers!

   I am a robot.

Blog

09 Aug 2015 . exploration . Zhongshan | China 15 Comments

Zhongshan (中山) is a city in the south of China. It’s a 45 minute bullet train (高铁) ride from Guangzhou’s main train station. The downtown area is clustered with electronics shops and all sorts of inflatable advertisements. Go beyond the downtown area and you can find thick mazes of small gray houses. I also visited the nearby Sun Yat-Sen High School. This places looks unreal! It’s like the backdrop of a Japanese high school drama or anime. There’s an a random boat in the pond! Lots and lots of green here. The sign at…
